Rules


All rules listed in the Boilerplate Game Rules (rev. April 23, 2014) page apply to this game except where contradicted in the additional rules below:

  1. Days will have a deadline of two weeks, and Nights will last 48 hours. Deadline extensions will be granted only in extreme circumstances.
  2. Prods will be issued to players if they have not posted within a 48-hour period. Players who have been prodded have 48 hours to respond in the game thread before a replacement is sought. Saturday and Sunday will be considered a 24-hour period for purposes of activity. Prods will be sent even during declared periods of V/LA; if you expect to be gone for an extended period of time, please contact me and we will work it out.
  3. Lynches occur through simple majority (50% of living players + 1, rounded down). If no majority is reached at deadline or there is a majority of votes for No Lynch, Day will end without a lynch. Once majority is reached, no further votes or unvotes will count.
  4. Dead players may not post until the game has been officially declared over; no "Bah!" posts.
  5. Actions not received by deadline will be counted as "No Action." Actions may be submitted ahead of time and can be changed as many times as desired; at deadline, the last valid action that was submitted will be used. Actions may be submitted via PM or private topic.
  6. Votes placed by accounts not present in the game will not be counted. Vote tricks will not be tolerated, and any judgment passed over the validity of any ambiguous votes is final.
  7. Do not use
    #BF0000
    . All other formatting is fair game.
  8. Flavor is for entertainment purposes only and has no significance in the game.
  9. Any situations not covered above will be handled on an individual basis. I reserve the right to add, modify, or remove rules as necessary.


Setup


This game was reviewed for balance and Normalcy by Cogito Ergo Sum, mastin2, and Zar.

The mafia have Day talk in this game.

Below is a sample town vanilla role PM:

Welcome to Mini 1752, XXX!

You are a
town vanilla
.

You have no special abilities beyond the right to vote.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one member of the town remains standing.

The game thread is here. Please confirm by responding to this PM with your alignment and role.

All role PMs are out! Please confirm as instructed in your PM. Confirmations are due by Saturday, January 2, 2016, at 2:00 AM EST (UTC-5), which is in (expired on 2016-01-02 02:00:00). Please note that this is 24 hours
before
the Night deadline.


Despite Christmas having come and gone, the festive cheer had yet to pass. Wreaths and ribbons could still be found along broken roads and darkened streetlamps, and no stripped trees could be found along any of the sidewalks. The sight of it would have made Mr. Scrooge choke if he were not so busy planning whatever it was that mafia organizations did. At least, that was the rumor around these parts. Nobody had any proof, of course, but it was hard to deny that the town was not given the level of care that it deserved given the amount of money it made from tourism and trade. Something was afoot here, and the townspeople were determined to discover what that was.


Night 0 begins now. The deadline is Sunday, January 3, 2016, at 2:00 AM EST (UTC-5), which is in (expired on 2016-01-03 02:00:00).

At the crack of dawn, a group of eleven townspeople marched to Marquis's house at the outskirts. The mob had not been planned but rather was a serendipitous occurrence, and it so happened that they thought they needed to see Marquis. Marquis was the person to see if anyone needed to learn something, whether it was about what kind of tool to use when WD-40 failed or about a fellow citizen. If anyone in town knew about the mafia's dealings, it would be Marquis. However, when the group reached Marquis's door, they found it ajar. There was not much of a need to enter, since the smell made it apparent that Marquis had not known about the impending murder last night. Someone entered anyway, just to make sure.


Marquis,
town vanilla
, has died on Night 0!

The idea behind this game was to ruin someone's day. This easily could have been an 11-player Day-start game. However, Night-start Normal games are not as common as they used to be, and, after petroleumjelly's Mini 1647, I thought I'd run one, as well. The original setup had a full tracker, which was town-sided; the reviewers recommended a change to either an X-shot bodyguard or a limited tracker, and I opted for the latter. Based on how this game played out, it still feels somewhat town-sided, but it could just be that the dominoes in this game happened to fall in favor of town.

To answer Supreme Overlord's inquiry about bodyguards and doctors in post 480: I would never have put both in the same game because I don't have an answer for it. :P

Thank you to everyone who played in the game, and special thanks to Xtoxm for replacing into the game. I'd also like to thank AxleGreaser and droog for offering to replace if a slot opened up.

I think the set-up is fairly balanced. 9 v 2 (how this game will effectively start) is scum-sided without power. The Town Bodyguard does not really add 'power' to the game, but simply might preserve the life of a single player once in the game in exchange for the Bodyguard's life. It's best trait is that it might be believed as a claim. The only true 'power' was the Even-Night Tracker, which is
pretty
weak, all things being said. The Mafia Commuter does not do much (except potentially 'confirm itself' if Tracked). The math on players also gives the Mafia the option to No-Kill on a night while still only needing four total mislynches to win, which can be used to more convincingly make a fake-claim, add confusion, etc.

Thanks for game.
